meanings.definition: To make or become tired or exhausted.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of playing outside, the children were wearied and ready for bed.
meanings.sent2: She wearied herself by running multiple errands in a row.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wearied himself out chasing his tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise of the construction work wearied the residents of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The hiker was wearied by the steep climb up the mountain.

meanings.sent1: The students wearied of the repetitive lessons and longed for something new.
meanings.sent2: As the meeting dragged on, he wearied of the endless discussions.
meanings.sent3: The toddler wearied of waiting for his turn and started to fidget in his seat.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project wearied as the challenges piled up.
meanings.sent5: The audience wearied of the speaker's monotonous voice and began to doze off.
